Description:
Ella's Cottage - The perfect Country Getaway
Situated in the picturesque township of Clunes (only 90 minutes from Melbourne and an easy drive to Daylesford, Ballarat and Castlemaine), this utterly charming double-fronted Victorian cottage invites you to take time out to relax, unwind and enjoy all the delights this historic goldfields region has to offer.
This gem of a property has been completely renovated and offers 2 double bedrooms, a cosy living room with gas fire, split cycle heating and cooling, a modern kitchen and sparkling bathroom.
Currently operating as popular self-contained accommodation, Ella's Cottage enjoys peace and privacy, nestled in pretty gardens complete with old walnut tree and surrounded by lovely mature hedges. Situated on quarter of an acre, but only a two minute stroll to shops and cafes, the property also provides plenty of room to extend or even subdivide (stca).
Glenda Rozen
Insights: 1 Cameron Street, Clunes VIC 3370 was last sold in 2017 and 7 other 2 bedroom house in Clunes have recently been sold.

Description:
Family Home within walking distance to all that Clunes has to offer.
This well situated 3 bedroom brick veneer family home is on a 1175m2 block with views across Creswick Creek & Queens Park. Close to the Clunes Bowling Club, is only one block from the main shopping/café precinct. Decorated with a 60's flair in keeping with the build, has timber flooring, a country kitchen which is the hub of this home. It offers a flexible layout with interchangeable spaces. The second living area is a great space to let the kids do their thing. Wood heating as well as 2 split systems take care of the change in seasons. The backyard is well fenced for privacy and includes a 4 car lock up garage at the front of the property as well as a 4 car garage at the rear with separate side access being a corner block. A short stroll to the shops and recreation facilities makes it a great family or retirement home.
Insights: 9 Ligar Street, Clunes VIC 3370 was last sold in 2017 and 17 other 3 bedroom house in Clunes have recently been sold.

Description:
A home with variety of options on 10 acres
If you are looking for a home to meet the needs of extended family or perhaps personal space for teenagers then this could be the one for you. This property includes a 2 bedroom house, 1 bedroom grannie flat and a 2 bedroom bungalow. The main house has a recently renovated kitchen with new bamboo flooring. Well set up for horses with 3 stables and tack room, shedding for horse float plus powered workshop, a nursery animal shelter and huge double carport. Divided into 4 paddocks with lovely country views. Only a few minutes drive to the centre of town.
For more information please contact Jo Millar on 0438 081 301 or Angela Flowers on 0437 456 908
Insights: 50 Mcdonalds Road, Clunes VIC 3370 was last sold in 2016 and 3 other 5 bedroom house in Clunes have recently been sold.

Description:
3 Bedroom home on 3/4 acre over 2 titles
Set on approx. 3/4 of an acre located at the end of a quiet street, you will find this lovely 3 bedroom home with views to surrounding hills. Polished timber floors, a feature of the wide entrance & living room along with the wood fire and split system, gives a welcoming country feel. The quality kitchen has a light, bright sunny aspect, plenty of cupboard space including a walk in pantry & electric cooking. The large modern bathroom has plenty of room to move with an extra toilet off the laundry. Watch the sun rise in the sunroom and set by the fire in the living room. With 8mx5m shedding, good fencing, enclosed yard and rear ramp for wheelchair access makes a lovely home, weekender or terrific investment.
Insights: 39 Canterbury Street, Clunes VIC 3370 was last sold in 2017 and 17 other 3 bedroom house in Clunes have recently been sold.

Description:
Great location with views.
Rebuilt from the ground up this very spacious newly renovated two bedroom home is a must see. The large windows in the open plan design are well placed to take advantage of its northern aspect. With polished timber floors and pure wool carpet, this home is well positioned on an elevated block with views to the front and rear and just 2 blocks to the historic main street of Clunes. Features include two good sized bedrooms, two bathrooms, very social kitchen great for entertaining, very effective built-in wood heating with cross breezes to keep home cool in the warmer months. The single car garage with workshop has extra space for a potential studio. Rear access and established easy care garden a bonus.
Inspection by appointment advised.
Insights: 15 Camp Street, Clunes VIC 3370 was last sold in 2017 and 7 other 2 bedroom house in Clunes have recently been sold.

Description:
2.38 acres of Rural Living in Clunes
If you're looking for the perfect block to build your dream home, this is it STCA! Clunes, an historic gold mining town, is ideal for a city escape without being cut off from the world and is only 30 minutes north of Ballarat, 1 ½ hours' drive west of Melbourne. With excellent public transport services available for both schools and the public " daily school bus service to Bray Raceway, V/Line bus service and a train service.
This 2.38 acre flat block will allow the owner STCA to build a dream home, a cricket pitch, the vegie garden and even a pool for the family!
- 9655m2 zoned Rural Living
- Power and water available
For more information please contact Jo Millar on 0438 081 301 or Angela Flowers on 0437 456 908
Insights: 6 Island Street, Clunes VIC 3370 was last sold in 2017.

Description:
Fully Serviced 3000m2 Clunes Township
Located in an elevated position yet flat block on fringe of the historical township of Clunes this fantastic opportunity to get a large portion of land to build your dream homw. Town water is connected with sewerage (low pressure system) and power at the boundary. A 5m x 7m shed is constructed on the land as is a transportable cabin which will be removed or stay as is
Being fully serviced this land is ready for your weekender or first home. Established trees and water connected allow immediate establishment of a garden infrastructure whilst you are waiting to build. Vendor keen to sell!

Description:
A Timeless Beauty
Stylish, spacious and character filled, this storybook home ?Greenview? offers chalet-style appeal while also offering panoramic views across the historic surrounds of Clunes and Creek Parade. Scattered with tulips and entwined with stunning wisteria, this romantic high quality home has been built with beautiful old world aesthetics combined with all the creature comforts of contemporary design and technology.
With massive street appeal, and positioned just minutes from the centre of Clunes Township, this six year old home offers two good size bedrooms with wooden windows, beautiful reflecting light fittings, stunning recycled doors throughout the entire home, exposed beams, lofty ceilings, spotted gum polished floors and a chic neutral décor. Timber lined walls, French doors and stain glass windows also add a special style to the décor, while blackwood benches, solid wood shaker style cabinetry, stainless steel appliances, attractive glazed Moroccan tiles and a generous pantry add to the look and the design of the country style kitchen.
Filled with natural light and offering a freestanding combustion heater surrounded by a bluestone inspired look alcove and air conditioning, this home also benefits from fabulous cross ventilation, especially from the elevated veranda and its second level windows and balcony. The bathroom exhibits a unique place to relax, with a claw footed bath, pressed metal dado height lining, pedestal vanity, elevated views and a visual elegance which is ?magazine worthy?. While a well-protected pergola with clear blinds offers a further room to entertain friends in absolute style.
Adding further appeal to this home and approx. 865m2 allotment, is a versatile sandstone look studio to the rear. An open fire place and natural light provides a gorgeous place for guests, while also offering an ideal place for a home office, sunny craft room or B&B accommodation (STCA). Surrounded by sunny reading nooks and offering sweet cottage plantings and a tranquil vine covered alfresco zone, this garden will not only add discovery benefits to B&B travellers, it will also delight the owners with perfumes, textures and ever changing colours throughout every season.
A high clearance shed with two roller doors, concrete floor & power provides excellent cover for vehicles; with a small garden shed adding storage for landscaping equipment. The only way to relate to this elegant showpiece is by arranging an inspection asap. Don?t delay, call today.
Insights: 17 other 3 bedroom house in Clunes have recently been sold.

Description:
Modern Family Home On Acreage
Set on approx. 4 acres is this beautiful family home with all of the modern comforts you could want. Featuring 4 bedrooms or 3 and a study, master with ensuite and double built in robe, spacious lounge room with wood heater and a formal lounge with split system air con, this home is ready to move in to with no hard work required. The kitchen contains electric cooking, good bench space, walk in pantry and overlooks the dining area, alfresco and large backyard. Externally, you will be impressed with the layout of the property which lends itself to multiple possibilities.
There is plenty of paddock space for animals as well as a large backyard for the kids to play. There is plenty of shedding on offer with a 6m x 10m shed with two open bays and one enclosed as well as a wood shed and a work shed which could be converted to a bungalow as it has power connected and plastered internally. Sit and relax in the alfresco area which overlooks the picturesque setting where peace and quiet is assured.
The school bus stops at the front gate and the property is just a short drive from the Clunes town ship where there are shops, cafes and sporting facilities. Fairview Drive is located off Fairview Road.
Inspect ASAP as we are sure you will be impressed.
Insights: 65 Fairview Drive, Clunes VIC 3370 was last sold in 2016 and 11 other 4 bedroom house in Clunes have recently been sold.

Description:
Hobby Farm On Approx. 20 Acres, In-Between The Heart Warming Towns Of Clunes & Creswick
Constructed efficiently with quality materials and workmanship, this weatherboard clad home offers an ideal three bedroom floor plan, with the added bonus and focus more on the fabulous 20 acres on offer. Fully fenced with panoramic views through to Mount Beckworth, this property is presented with a long private driveway, wind shelters, a huge shed with two roller doors plus concreted floors and a massive water tank for maximum water catchment for household use. Horse enthusiasts will be certainly interested or even those looking for a modest property for those relaxing weekend getaways or hobby farm pursuits.
Whilst entry is directly into the kitchen, this home has been designed to utilize the kitchen, dining and lounge area as the fundamental hub. Extremely functional with generous bench space, many cupboards & drawers and SS appliances, this user friendly zone is perfect to cook, eat and also entertain. The master bedroom boasts a sunny bay window, wall to wall carpet and built in robes, while the two other bedrooms are cosy under feet and are positioned next to the family bathroom which provides a shower/bath combination (instantaneous hot water), vanity and toilet. Comforted by an electric wall heater and a handy split system, the entire home and design to be warmed naturally by the sun, therefore reducing energy costs.
Outdoors offers a slightly raised rear deck for entertaining under the stars, while also offering protection and views across the land and beyond. Currently leased at $300 per week, this property proves investment properties in the country work well, along with an ideal way to secure your future home. For exact land measures, rates and further details, please contact our agent today.
Insights: 155 McLennans Road, Clunes VIC 3370 was last sold in 2016 and 17 other 3 bedroom house in Clunes have recently been sold.

Description:
Ideal for first home buyer or investor on 727m2
Once the home of the Clunes Station master, this 1938 railway home is only a stones throw from the station and directly opposite the Clunes Health Service. With good solid bones, a spot of renovation would see this property through for many years to come, Includes 3 large bedrooms, high ceilings, wide hallway and timber paneling in the north facing lounge, a feature of the period. The built-in wood heater provides a very cosy arrangement in the winter months. A servery through to the kitchen, includes an IXL combustion stove as well as an electric stove and has clear views of Mount Beckworth.
Rear access provides plenty of off road parking.
Perfect location for Ballarat/Melbourne travelers
For further information please contact Jo Millar 0438 081 301 or Angela Flowers 0437 456 908

Description:
3 ACRES IN CLUNES
3 acre rural living block available in Clunes with 30'x10' shed with concrete floor and great insulation. Power, telephone and water have all been connected to the block and a gravel road constructed with a crossover. The owner has previously had a planning permit for a house which has lapsed. These plans can be provided on request. A flat block with a nice view where all the hard work has been done doesn't come up very often so be quick to inspect this one.

Description:
Great Potential on 7 acres
This one is for the buyer who has a vision to see this property reach its full potential. With a little bit of TLC, you can add your own personal touch to this roomy family home. Features include: 3 Bedrooms, master with huge en-suite, timber flooring in living area, large kitchen and dining area, wood heating, air conditioner, veranda to front and back with single carport. Shedding includes stables and open machinery shed. Semi circular drive for easy access, rear paddock, dam, town water, on school bus route and only a few minutes to centre of township.
For more information please contact Jo Millar 0438 081 301 or
tttttttAngela Flowers 0437 456 908

Description:
2 Bedroom Cottage with Studio on 2 Titles
Set on approximately 1333sqm (including 3 Whyte St), this quaint little cottage has 2 bedrooms plus study with Studio attached. Perfect for a weekend getaway or make it your permanent home.
Features include north facing French doors which overlook the established garden including shade & fruit trees taking full advantage of the winter sun. Polished timber floors and high ceilings add to the charm. The ideal studio space including a combustion stove, may also be used as a second living or rumpus room. Wood heating in lounge, Split Systems to bedrooms, electric hws, lpg cooking and SLUG with workshop.
With veranda on 2 sides, an elevated location takes in pleasant views across the valley and only a few minutes walk to the heart of the township.
For more information please contact Jo Millar on 0438 081 301 or Angela Flowers on 0437 456 908

Description:
1ha (app 2.5acre) Homesite with country views and open outlook
A wonderful lifestyle 2.5acre (app.) allotment only minutes to Primary school and walking distance to town centre. Fully fenced, with water connected and power available, this homesite offers a great open outlook with views of Mt Beckworth and surrounding areas. Set amongst similar size properties, and just over 1.5km to the post office, it is hard to find this sort of land parcel at such an affordable price. Don't delay your purchase. Inspect today or you may miss out!
